result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward A Schierland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Eligible for Substance Abuse and Challenge Incarceration Programs AFTER 2 years.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  
10% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Work full-time, go to school full-time or a combination thereof.
Comply with all Aftercare treatment recommendations for AODA issues.  If he does not get the treatment in prison, have AODA and comply with treatment recommendations.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Engage in any other counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by the agent. 
All prescriptions from one (1) pharmacy. 
Must sign all necessary releases to DOC so they can monitor prescriptions, mental or healthcare providers he is seeing. 
Submit a DNA sample, if not already done so.

Defendant replies.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edward A Schierland in court with attorney Jeffrey Jazgar. Defendant Edward A Schierland in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:33 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 3 & 4 are dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Jazgar makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Constable makes additional statements to the Court. 
Atty Jazgar makes additional statements to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
5 years prison 
3 years Initial Confinement, commencing today. 
2 years Extended Supervision

Count 2 - 
5 years prison 
3 years Initial Confinement, commencing today.
2 years Extended Supervision
Concurrent with Count 1.

Conditions: 
Comply with all Aftercare treatment recommendations for AODA issues. 
If he does not get the treatment in prison, have AODA and comply with treatment recommendations. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Engage in any other counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by agent. 
Work fulltime, go to school fulltime or a combination thereof. 
All prescriptions from one (1) pharmacy. 
Must sign all necessary releases to DOC so they can monitor prescriptions, mental or healthcare providers he is seeing. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Submit a DNA sample, if not already done so. 
10% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Eligible for Earned Release and Challenge Incarceration programs AFTER 2 years.

Arraignment on March 30, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Edward A Schierland not in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
